name: AminoAnalytica
headline: Your biotech's first AI protein engineer
description: At AminoAnalytica, we specialize in AI-powered protein optimization. We‚Äôre developing the world's first dedicated AI agent for protein engineering (or AI protein engineer, if you will) that integrates with 'human' bioengineering teams. Common protein engineering challenges like protein property enhancement ‚Äì whether it's the stability of therapeutic peptides or the activity of industrial enzymes at high temperatures ‚Äì can now be done semi-autonomously, at a fraction of the cost.
tags: industry:synthetic-biology; industry:biotech; industry:manufacturing; industry:climate; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Abhi Rajendran, CEO & Co-founder
founders.description: Materials Engineer from Imperial College London. I previously worked at the Mercedes Formula 1 Team and now work at the intersection of AI and Protein Design - there's a funny story in there somewhere.

founders.name: Matteo Peluso, Founder
founders.description: Compute credits are all you need

founders.name: Adam Wu, CSO & Founder
founders.description:
Materials scientist from Imperial College London. Previously done work on molecular simulations and in chemistry labs.

Shameless plug: check out 'adwuu' on spotify for a good time

### **The future of protein engineering is AI**
#### Computationally optimize any protein with your team‚Äôs first AI protein engineer.
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/660f2da8e15bd101360159f4/d897c2a9-21f7-438d-ad32-03ce9fd4eb6c/backed+by+YC.png)

At AminoAnalytica, we specialize in **AI-powered protein optimization**. We‚Äôve developed a suite of AI agents (or **AI protein engineers**), that can seamlessly improve the properties of your target protein sequence from the stability of therapeutic peptides to the activity of industrial enzymes.
When we optimize your protein, it‚Äôs not just a theoretical suggestion ‚Äì our proprietary **state-of-the-art models** and **physics-based simulations** ensure that the proteins we improve are functional in the real world, expressible at high yields, and stable under the necessary conditions.
  * ####  State-of-the-Art AI Models üß† 
Our computational protein engineering pipelines are built upon proprietary models that outperform the current gold standard tools ‚Äì delivering unparalleled customizability and accuracy.
Feel free to reach out to find out more about how our pipelines can optimize your protein!
  * ####  Custom Molecular Simulations ‚öõÔ∏è 
Our pipeline is not AI end-to-end. We utilize the power of physics-based protein simulations to validate our AI model outputs without needing expensive wet lab testing. Think of it like a spell-checker for AI engineered proteins.
Finally, AI that you can truly trust!
  * ####  In-vitro Validation üß™ 
We need to see a result to believe it. That‚Äôs why we recommend performing assays on the top candidates to confirm their improved properties.
If this is something you‚Äôd like us to handle on your behalf, let us know!
  * ####  Human-in-the-Loop üë©‍üî¨ 
We understand the nuances of protein engineering, which is why we prioritize a transparent human-in-the-loop process. This ensures that real (non-AI) scientists maintain full control over every step, whether it‚Äôs our in-house experts or your team. You benefit from the efficiency, practicality, and intelligence of our AI protein engineers while retaining complete expert supervision.


## **Ready to create the next**
## **world-changing protein?**

generated_description:
### AminoAnalytica: A Peek into the Future of Protein Engineering

AminoAnalytica is a cutting-edge biotech startup founded in 2024, located in the heart of San Francisco. As part of the Y Combinator Batch S24, this small yet ambitious team of two is on a mission to revolutionize protein engineering by integrating artificial intelligence into the traditionally labor-intensive process.

At its core, AminoAnalytica aims to be "your biotech's first AI protein engineer." They are developing an AI-powered platform to address common challenges in protein engineering, such as enhancing the stability of therapeutic peptides and improving the performance of industrial enzymes under various conditions. By utilizing advanced AI models and physics-based simulations, they promise to deliver significant improvements in protein properties while reducing costs and time compared to conventional methods.

Here‚Äôs what sets them apart:

1. **State-of-the-Art AI Models**: Their proprietary pipelines outperform existing tools, promising tailored solutions with precision and reliability.

2. **Custom Molecular Simulations**: By validating AI model outputs through physics-based simulations, they ensure real-world applicability without the initial high costs associated with lab testing.

3. **Human-in-the-Loop Process**: Recognizing the complexity of protein engineering, AminoAnalytica emphasizes a collaborative approach between AI and human scientists, ensuring that human expertise directs every stage of the engineering process.

4. **In-vitro Validation**: They propose to perform tests on top candidate proteins to confirm their improved properties, providing an extra layer of assurance.

AminoAnalytica is not just about optimizing proteins; they position themselves as a partner that combines the efficiency of AI with the irreplaceable insight of human scientists. This approach signals a new era in biotech, where collaboration between man and machine creates possibilities that neither could achieve alone.

If you‚Äôre curious about how AI can enhance your protein engineering efforts, or if you want to be part of this exciting journey, check out their website [AminoAnalytica](https://www.aminoanalytica.com) or reach out directly at founders@aminoanalytica.com.

As they say, the future of protein engineering is indeed AI‚Äîa future that is knocking at your lab door, ready to change the game.
